data.enText: quicker
quickest

data.chText: 快的；迅速的；时间短暂的
data.enText: done with speed; taking or lasting a short time
She gave him a quick glance.

data.chText: 这些糕饼做起来又快又简单。
data.enText: These cakes are very quick and easy to make.
Would you like a quick drink?

data.chText: 医生说她很快就能康复。
data.enText: The doctor said she'd make a quick recovery.
It's quicker by train.

data.chText: 你确信这是最快捷的方法吗？
data.enText: Are you sure this is the quickest way?
Have you finished already? That was quick!

data.chText: 他敏捷的思考救了她一命。
data.enText: His quick thinking saved her life.
He fired three shots in quick succession .
moving or doing sth fast
a quick learner
The kids were quick to learn.
She was quick (= too quick) to point out the mistakes I'd made.

data.chText: 她敏捷的双手突然停下不动了。
data.enText: Her quick hands suddenly stopped moving.

data.chText: 你尽量快点！我们已经晚了。
data.enText: Try to be quick ! We're late already.

data.chText: 他的急智使他再次摆脱了窘境。
data.enText: Once again, his quick wits (= quick thinking) got him out of an awkward situation.
He's a quick study (= he learns quickly) .
happening very soon or without delay
We need to make a quick decision.

data.chText: 这公司要立竿见影的成果。
data.enText: The company wants quick results.
to have a quick temper
to become angry easily
quick and dirty
used to describe sth that is usually complicated, but is being done quickly and simply in this case

data.chText: 阅读一下我们的建立网站便捷指南。
data.enText: Read our quick-and-dirty guide to creating a website.
make a fast/quick buck
to earn money quickly and easily
be quick/fast on the draw
to be quick to understand or react in a new situation

data.chText: 你骗不了他，他脑筋一向很快。
data.enText: You can't fool him─ he's always quick on the draw.
to be quick at pulling out a gun in order to shoot it
quick/slow off the mark

data.chText: （对形势的）反应敏捷 / 迟钝
data.enText: fast/slow in reacting to a situation
quicker
quickest
quickly; fast
Come as quick as you can!
Let's see who can get there quickest.

data.chText: 那是他迅速致富的另一种计谋。
data.enText: It's another of his schemes to get rich quick .
doing the thing mentioned quickly
quick-thinking
quick-growing
(as) quick as a flash
very quickly
Quick as a flash she was at his side.
the soft, sensitive flesh that is under your nails

data.chText: 她咬指甲都咬到了活肉。
data.enText: She has bitten her nails down to the quick.
cut sb to the quick

data.chText: （以恶意的言行）深深伤害，把…伤害到家
data.enText: to upset sb very much by doing or saying sth unkind

data.chText: 这些形容词常与下列名词连用：
data.enText: These adjectives are frequently used with the following nouns.

data.chText: fast尤用以描述高速运动的人或事物。
data.enText: Fast is used especially to describe a person or thing that moves or is able to move at great speed.

data.chText: quick较常用以描述迅速或立即完成的事。
data.enText: Quick is more often used to describe something that is done in a short time or without delay.
Rapid , swift and speedy are more formal words.

data.chText: rapid最常用于描述事物变化的速度，而非运动或完成的速度：
data.enText: Rapid is most commonly used to describe the speed at which something changes. It is not used to describe the speed at which something moves or is done.
a rapid train
We had a rapid coffee.

data.chText: swift通常用以描述事物发生或完成的速度快而及时：
data.enText: Swift usually describes something that happens or is done quickly and immediately.
a swift decision
The government took swift action.
Speedy has a similar meaning.
a speedy recovery

data.chText: 该词较少用于指事物运动的速度：
data.enText: It is used less often to talk about the speed at which something moves.
a speedy car.

data.text: as adverbs, see the usage note at
关于fast和quick作副词的用法，见quick词条的用法说明。

data.enText: Quickly is the usual adverb from quick .

data.chText: 我很快意识到我坐错了火车。
data.enText: I quickly realized that I was on the wrong train.
My heart started to beat more quickly.

data.chText: 在日常用语中，quick有时用作副词，尤作感叹语：
data.enText: Quick is sometimes used as an adverb in very informal language, especially as an exclamation.

data.chText: 快点吧！快！他们会看见我们的！
data.enText: Come on! Quick! They’ll see us!
Quicker is used more often.
My heart started to beat much quicker.

data.chText: 我越快送你离开此地越好。
data.enText: The quicker I get you away from here, the better.

data.chText: 指某人或某物移动的速度多用fast：
data.enText: Fast is more often used when you are talking about the speed that somebody or something moves at.

data.chText: 猎豹奔跑的速度有多快？
data.enText: How fast can a cheetah run?
Can't you drive any faster?
You’re driving too quickly.
There is no word fastly .

ex.enText: She took a fast train to Shanghai.

synonyms.bx: 指移动速度快的或能够快速移动的，也可指迅速或立即发生的。

ex.chText: 她给了老师一个迅速的回答。
ex.enText: She gave the teacher a quick answer.

ex.chText: 他是一个机灵的男孩子。

ex.enText: The employee is a quick learner.

synonyms.bx: 指持续或耗费时间短的，移动、做事等速度快的，或指人聪明、机敏的。

ex.chText: 这家公司在过去10年间利润快速增长。
ex.enText: The company made a rapid profit growth in the last decade.

ex.chText: 听到脚步声，那两名小偷飞快地溜走了。
ex.enText: Hearing footsteps, the two thieves made a swift exit.

synonyms.bx: 指立即发生或马上做出的；也可指移动速度快的或能够快速移动的，作此义解时只作定语。

ex.zh: 学习能力强的人；学得快的人
小问题；能快速解答的问题

data.enText: to have a quick temper
to become angry easily
quick and dirty
used to describe sth that is usually complicated, but is being done quickly and simply in this case

data.enText: Read our quick-and-dirty guide to creating a website.
make a fast/quick buck
to earn money quickly and easily
be quick/fast on the draw
to be quick to understand or react in a new situation

data.chText: 你骗不了他，他脑筋一向很快。
data.enText: You can't fool him─ he's always quick on the draw.
to be quick at pulling out a gun in order to shoot it
quick/slow off the mark

data.chText: （对形势的）反应敏捷 / 迟钝
data.enText: fast/slow in reacting to a situation
be quick/slow on the uptake
to be quick/slow to understand sth

data.chText: 他总是理解得这么慢吗？
data.enText: Is he always this slow on the uptake?
(as) quick as a flash
very quickly
Quick as a flash she was at his side.
cut sb to the quick

data.chText: （以恶意的言行）深深伤害，把…伤害到家
data.enText: to upset sb very much by doing or saying sth unkind

tr: any area of the body that is highly sensitive to pain (as the flesh underneath the skin or a fingernail or toenail)

example: sleek and agile as a gymnast
the old dog was so spry it was halfway up the stairs before we could stop it

tr: performed with little or no delay
example: an immediate reply to my letter
his quick reaction prevented an accident
hoped for a speedy resolution of the problem
he has a right to a speedy trial
took a flying glance at the book

tr: apprehending and responding with speed and sensitivity

value.def: Someone or something that is quick moves or does things with great speed.

example.ex: You'll have to be quick. The flight leaves in about three hours...
example.tran: 你得快点了，飞机大约3小时后起飞。

example.ex: I think I'm a reasonably quick learner...
example.tran: 我认为我是一个学东西还算快的人。

example.ex: Europe has moved a long way since then at a very quick pace.
example.tran: 从那以后，欧洲迅速发展，并取得了长足的进步。

example.ex: Cussane worked quickly and methodically...
example.tran: 库塞因干活很利索，且有条不紊。

example.ex: Stop me if I'm speaking too quickly.
example.tran: 要是我讲得太快，请打断我。

example.ex: ...the natural quickness of his mind.
example.tran: 他天生的敏捷反应

value.def: Quicker is sometimes used to mean 'at a greater speed', and quickest to mean 'at the greatest speed'. Quick is sometimes used to mean 'with great speed'. Some people consider this to be non-standard.

example.ex: Warm the sugar slightly first to make it dissolve quicker...
example.tran: 先将糖稍稍加热，以使其溶解得更快些。

example.ex: Prost went quickest.
example.tran: 普罗斯特走得最快。

value.tran: (quicker 有时表示“以更快的速度”，quickest表示“以最快的速度”，quick有时表示“以很快的速度”，但有些人认为这种用法并不规范)

value.def: Something that is quick takes or lasts only a short time.

example.ex: He took one last quick look about the room...
example.tran: 他朝房间匆匆扫了最后一眼。

example.ex: I just popped in for a quick drink...
example.tran: 我只是顺路过来小酌一杯。

example.ex: Although this recipe looks long, it is actually very quick to prepare...
example.tran: 尽管这个菜谱看上去很长，其实做起来很快。

example.ex: My father would have driven me to Cornwall, but we decided it would be quicker by train.
example.tran: 父亲原本要开车送我去康沃尔，但我们还是觉得坐火车更快。

value.tran: 短暂的;持续时间很短的

example.ex: You can become fitter quite quickly and easily.
example.tran: 你可以非常迅速而且轻松地变得更健康。

value.def: Quick means happening without delay or with very little delay.

example.ex: Officials played down any hope for a quick end to the bloodshed...
example.tran: 官员们让迅速结束这场流血冲突的希望变得渺茫起来。

example.ex: These investors feel the need to make quick profits.
example.tran: 这些投资者觉得收益必须立竿见影。

value.tran: 立刻发生的;很快发生的

example.ex: We need to get it back as quickly as possible...
example.tran: 我们得尽快把它拿回来。

example.ex: It quickly became the most popular men's fragrance in the world...
example.tran: 它很快成为世界上最受欢迎的男士香水。

example.ex: 'Not me,' Robarts said quickly.
example.tran: “不是我，”罗巴茨立即说道。

value.def: Quick is sometimes used to mean 'with very little delay'.

example.ex: I got away as quick as I could...
example.tran: 我尽快离开了。

example.ex: Quick! John! It's Carmela. I think she's taken an overdose...
example.tran: 快来！约翰！卡梅拉出事了，我想她用药过量了。

example.ex: The advantage in going faster is that you get there quicker.
example.tran: 快点走的好处在于，你可以早点到达那里。

value.tran: 迅速发生地;很快发生地

value.def: If you are quick to do something, you do not hesitate to do it.

example.ex: Mark says the ideas are Katie's own, and is quick to praise her talent...
example.tran: 马克说这些都是凯蒂自己的想法，并随即称赞起她的天赋来。

example.ex: Furthermore, as Gervaise was quick to point out, Mr Scully was not a detective.
example.tran: 而且，正如热尔韦斯毫不犹豫地指出来的那样，斯库利先生并不是一名侦探。

value.def: If someone has a quick temper, they are easily made angry.
value.tran: 性情急躁的;容易发怒的

value.def: If someone bites their nails to the quick, they bite off all the white part at the end of each nail.

example.ex: Her fingernails are bitten to the quick.
example.tran: 她的手指甲都被咬秃了。

value.tran: 咬到了指甲肉；咬秃指甲

value.def: If something cuts you to the quick, it makes you feel very upset.

example.ex: I once heard her weeping in her bedroom, which cut me to the quick.
example.tran: 有一次，我听见她在卧室里哭泣，这深深地刺痛了我的心。

value.tran: 触及（…）痛处;极大伤害；令…伤透了心

trans: 快速康复；快速恢复；急速恢复；快速防御；快速回复
快餐；快捷服务；快速维护；快餐服务；快速服务
应急解决办法；权宜之计
动不动就开枪的；行动迅速的
两男一女三逃犯；两女一男三逃犯；快速变换；快换；快速切换
